content:
Hi :wave: everyone, I have been using Rust for providing a wrapper for ArrayFire library. Just saw the blog post about portable SIMD API. I would like to participate and if possible contribute

Note: I live in IST timezone.

Hi @pradeep garigipati! The portable simd project group can be found on zulip at #project-portable-simd. Feel free to say hi there. The actual work is being done at https://github.com/rust-lang/stdsimd.

FYI Streams are not visible in the sidebar unless you subscribe to them. If you click the link for #project-portable-simd you will see a subscribe button. For all other cases you can click the cog symbol next to streams. In the top left corner you can switch to showing all streams in the popup. If you then click on a stream, there will be a subscribe button on the right side.

bjorn3 said:

FYI Streams are not visible in the sidebar unless you subscribe to them. If you click the link for #project-portable-simd you will see a subscribe button. For all other cases you can click the cog symbol next to streams. In the top left corner you can switch to showing all streams in the popup. If you then click on a stream, there will be a subscribe button on the right side.

Sure, thank you for the info. Zulip is new to me, it was indeed confusing earlier :)
